author: Staff Reporter
text:
Around 20,000 personnel, including 4,500 policemen, are to be deployed for election work in various stages as Madurai district gears up for the Assembly poll elections, said Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao, while addressing the media soon after the announcement of election dates on Friday.

Mr. Rao said that special security arrangements with the deployment of paramilitary forces would be made in 509 of the 2,685 polling booths in the district which had been identified as vulnerable.

Voter Verified Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) would be used on a trial basis in Madurai East constituency alone for which special training would be given to polling personnel, Mr. Rao said.

VVPAT refers to small equipment connected to Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) which, for every vote, will print the name of the candidate chosen by the voter and can be retained for verification.

Pointing out that the election Model Code of Conduct (MCC) had come into force with immediate effect, Mr. Rao said that tactical surveillance teams, video surveillance teams, expenditure monitoring teams and round-the-clock flying squads would swing into action to monitor any violations of MCC. He added that a 24/7 helpline and WhatsApp numbers would be announced for anyone to register complaints.

Later, the Collector chaired a meeting in the presence of Police Commissioner Shailesh Kumar Yadav, Superintendent of Police Vijayendra S. Bidari and Additional Collector B. Rohini Ramdas to discuss preparation work with the Returning Officers from all ten constituencies in the district.
title: 20,000 personnel to be deployed for election work
